notesStmt.note: Rabbi Gershom ben Yeḳutiel: inscribed with his name in the colophon, 5120 [1360] (folio 320v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Fourth Book of Arba'ah Ṭurim, Ṭur ḥoshen mishpaṭ, of Jacob ben Asher.

msItem.title: Ṭur ḥoshen mishpaṭ טור חשן משפט

collation.p: 41 quires: i10 (folios 1-10), ii3 (folios 11-13), iii-vi8 (folios 14-45), vii6 (folios 46-51), viii-xxvii8 (folios 52-211), xxviii6 (folios 212-217), xxix-xli8 (folios 218-320a), marked with vertical catchwords at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi semi-cursive script of the 14th century, unpunctuated. Yehudah bar Yosef Erama (?): inscribed with his name in the colophon, 5120 [1360] (folio 320v); the name Yehudah is marked many times (e.g., folios 48v, 58v, 76v, 113v, 117r, 117v, 162v, 246v, 260r, 297r); acrostic of Yehudah (folio 320v).

decoDesc.decoNote: Numerous decorated initial words with red and blue pen-flourishing.
Numerous pen-flourishing around initial words spreading into the margins creating a partial border in colours and gold.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Jacob ben Asher. Tur Choshen Ham-Mishpat. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,137.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 244: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153: inscribed (folio [321v]).
